text: Not to mention the entire cohort of analytics and engagement data that should also be "ported" somehow. A while ago I coded a custom form which submitted data via a middleware and because HubSpot wasn't registering this as a submit event it didn't trigger all the analytics and engagement data. I remember this caused quite a big issue with marketing folks.

is this something I'm logging or something HubSpot is automatically logging?
```Hydrating root island-d2d6eci5R0 load```

Hi guys :slightly_smiling_face: Just discovered it was possible to create react websites with this tool. Do you know if there is something existing that could allow me to "convert" legacy modules to jsx components? I'm doing it manually at the time
Unfortunately there is no tool we have that can do this automatically for you.

this is a shot in the dark but just in case, has anyone had trouble publishing multiple pages through content staging? publishing one page works but multiple pages at the same time fail. Very unlikely (and we opened a ticket) but I'm curious if it might somehow be react related
I wish I had this a few weeks ago!
Is there any support coming that would allow fetching serverless function data into a react module/component?

Is it just me, or does it feel like embedding HubL in React is a step in the wrong direction?

IMHO, I'd much prefer to grab and expose data via the API and have more support for in a React component to a serverless function) than writing HubL in React.

Passing data from HubL to a react component also doesn't feel overly nature, but understand it's a bit of a stepping stone. If HS is going to support React, why not support it as a more headless approach using Vite (if that's the preference?

It'd be great to understand the design choices being made here and what's the longer term direction?

HubL template strings in React components to “pass data” is certainly a stopgap. But we realized it was an important one because there is a large HubL surface area and we want to avoid blocking folx on us providing new React-based APIs for all the things.

This isn’t a great time to offer a lot more vision and context, but I appreciate and understand the request.
